description:
The objective of this course is to examine the development of Taoism from the Song dynasty to the current period. We will examine the rise of Thunder
Magic and the Divine Empyrean movements of the Song, the rise of new schools of inner alchemy in the Ming, the spread of Lu Dongbin related spirit writing in the Qing, and the proliferation of regional Taoist ritual traditions in late modern period. The course will combine sinological methods with historical,
anthropological and religious studies methodologies. The course will focus on the reading of original documents.
title: Seminar in Modern Taoism
prerequisite: Completion of an undergraduate degree in Chinese Studies (or permission of the instructor)
